questions.text: "How about if we say when it's wet, it's wet?" was what VP Dan Quayle stated when asked to describe what?
questions.explanation:
Wetlands.

	Talk about stating the absolute obvious - well done Dan, might I say, one of your better quips!  This quote is included in, 'What a Waste It Is to Lose One's Mind', the unauthorised biography of Dan Quayle - the name of this tome was taken from when the then VP tried to quote the slogan of the United Negro College Fund, "A mind is a terrible thing to waste."

future.

	Really Dan, and how did you work that one out?

questions.text: "We're all capable of mistakes, but I do not care to _______ you on the mistakes we may or may not have made."
questions.explanation:
enlighten.

	As reported in USA Today in 1992.  What a wonderful choice of word for Dan Quayle to use, 'enlighten' - mmmm, let's just ponder that one!

verbosity.

	Dan Quayle being verbose, now that conjures a mental picture!

questions.text: "He starts around the turn of the century up through Vietnam, and it's a very good historical book about ________ . "
questions.explanation:
history.

	I love this one in particular, VP Dan Quayle on author Paul Johnson's book, 'Modern Times', in 1993.  What else would an historical book be about Dan?

questions.text: "I should have caught the mistake on that spelling bee card, but as __________ once said - You should never trust a man who has only one way to spell a word."
questions.explanation:
Mark Twain.

	Great quote, but it was former American President Andrew Jackson's quote, not Mark Twain's!  Now don't tell me, Dan used to be indecisive, but now he's not so sure!

questions.text: "My friends, no matter how rough the road may be, we can and we will never, never surrender to what is _____ . "
questions.explanation:
right.

	VP Dan Quayle speaking to the Christian Coalition about the need for abstinence to avoid AIDS, in 1991.  Now aren't we glad Dan was further quoted as having said, "The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that Dan Quayle may or may not make!"  This was in a speech to the American Society of Newspaper Editors.

questions.text: "This President is going to lead us out of this _______ - it will happen".
questions.explanation:
recovery.

	VP Dan Quayle at a campaign stop at a University in 1992.

questions.text: "I've been told to keep my remarks relatively brief, I understand ______-hunting season begins at noon".
questions.explanation:
Quayle.

	Senator Dan Quayle to a crowd in Wisconsin, as reported in the LA Times in 1988.

questions.text: "For NASA, ______ is still a high priority."
questions.explanation:
space.

	Oh dear, what can you say, but, Dan, get a grip - engage the brain cells before opening the trap door!  This was VP Dan Quayle in 1990 talking to NASA employees.
